title: How to Play Dice Civilizations

steps.headline: Get A3/A4 paper or poster paper with your territory drawn on.
steps.description: Make sure it's enough for each of you and your friends!

steps.headline: Draw the world where your game will take place and draw the trees and mountains and whatnot
Draw where your leader lives.
steps.description: It can be a house, apartment, condo, tent, secret lair, etc. !

steps.headline: Draw some houses, shops, places of work, and places of worship!!!
Draw your ruler somewhere on the paper.
steps.description: Give them a title and, if you want, say what they look like!

steps.headline: Draw some citizens.
steps.description: They can be aliens, dinosaurs, bunnies, stick men, cavemen, robots, mutants, etc. !

steps.headline: Draw some special citizens like soldiers or cow farmers.
Make allies or enemies with your friend's civilizations.
Make sure you get more paper to make more cities!
Get someone to draw a map of the world with cities to conquer when you and your friends civilizations meet up.
steps.description: If you're enemies, you have to battle(explained below)!! !

steps.headline: Have a 1-15 amount of people defending houses, shops, places of work, and places of worship.
When in combat, Play Rock-Paper-Scissors (could be best-of-3), and the winner rolls a 6-sided dice.
steps.description: Whatever number it lands on, That's the number of people to take off the opponent's land. (If you have 2  dice, Then the number on Die #1 and Die #2 needs to be added up.)

text: Have friends. It's better with friends! Get A3/A4 paper or poster paper with your territory drawn on. Make sure it's enough for each of you and your friends! Draw the world where your game will take place and draw the trees and mountains and whatnot  Draw where your leader lives. It can be a house, apartment, condo, tent, secret lair, etc. ! Draw some houses, shops, places of work, and places of worship!!! ! Draw your ruler somewhere on the paper. Give them a title and, if you want, say what they look like! Draw some citizens. They can be aliens, dinosaurs, bunnies, stick men, cavemen, robots, mutants, etc. ! Draw some special citizens like soldiers or cow farmers.  Make allies or enemies with your friend's civilizations.  Make sure you get more paper to make more cities!  Get someone to draw a map of the world with cities to conquer when you and your friends civilizations meet up. If you're enemies, you have to battle(explained below)!! ! Have a 1-15 amount of people defending houses, shops, places of work, and places of worship.  When in combat, Play Rock-Paper-Scissors (could be best-of-3), and the winner rolls a 6-sided dice. Whatever number it lands on, That's the number of people to take off the opponent's land. (If you have 2  dice, Then the number on Die #1 and Die #2 needs to be added up.)
